turns.content: In google cloud, using centos7, what ssh command do I issue to reboot

To reboot a CentOS 7 machine on Google Cloud using SSH, you can use the command:
```
sudo reboot
```
This command will reboot the machine immediately. If you want to shut down the machine and then power it back on, you can use the command:
```
sudo shutdown -r now
```
This will shut down the machine and then power it back on, the "-r" option is for reboot.

To exit the current session, you can use the command `exit`. This command will close the current terminal window or end the current SSH session. If you're using a GUI terminal, you can also click on the "X" button in the top right corner of the window.

You can also use `logout` command to log out of a login shell or terminal session.

If you are in a specific program you may use different command to exit, depends on the program you are using.

Please let me know if you have any other question.
how can I log out of the list unit files

The `systemctl list-unit-files` command is used to show a list of all unit files and their current state on a CentOS 7 machine. This command does not create a login session, so there is no need to log out.

Once you run the command and view the list of unit files, you can simply close the terminal window or press the `Enter` key to return to the command prompt.

You can also use the `Ctrl + C` keyboard shortcut to immediately stop the command and return to the command prompt.

If you are in a specific program you may use different command to exit, depends on the program you are using.

Please let me know if you have any other question or if there's anything else I can help you with.
